critical_issues: Invalid line reference in claim_audit.json: Claim C03 cites line_ref "L52" for a quote that actually appears on L53 (L52 is only the "## Practical Takeaway" header). This violates the requirement that line references be valid and map to the numbered report lines.

Calibration/overstatement risk: claim_audit.json C01 labels the conclusion as "strength": "strong" based mainly on a likelihood ratio of 7.4 (L31) plus model mismatch (L35). The report’s framing is more cautious (“meaningful evidence against a strictly airless interpretation… composition and pressure remain uncertain… follow-up essential”, L53) and highlights substantial degeneracies and systematics (L37–L50).

Wording overreach: claim_audit.json C05 says “A detected 15 μm feature…”, whereas the report describes a “15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate” and that the structure is “consistent with atmospheric absorption” (L30), with explicit caveats about weak-feature bias from stellar variability and instrument systematics (L49). “Detected” implies higher confidence than “consistent with.”
value.summary: The JSON outputs largely track the report’s main quantitative values (L27–L32) and key caveats (L46–L50), but they fail the grading criteria due to at least one incorrect/invalid line reference (C03 cites L52 instead of L53) and multiple instances of overstated claim strength (e.g., “strong” overall evidence and “detected” 15 µm feature) relative to the report’s explicitly cautious interpretation and listed degeneracies/systematics.
